data: ED DTU Community Acquired Pneumonia (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge

DTU Eligibility Criteria:
Inclusion Criteria (ALL must apply):
- Stable vital signs
- Oxygen saturation greater than 90%
- Results of initial investigations (Chest X-Ray, bloodwork) available
- CRB-65 score 0 to 2
- Observation of greater than 4 hours required, but anticipate discharge
- Initial antibiotic medications given
- Able to mobilize with assistance 

Exclusion Criteria (ANY may apply):
- Airborne isolation required
- Abnormal mental status
- Shallow, laboured breathing, persistent use of accessory muscles
- Signs of sepsis or metabolic acidosis
- CRB-65 score 3 or over
- Immunocompromise, asplenia, or other significant comorbidities including malignancy, end stage renal disease, cirrhosis, AIDS, or stroke
- Suspected TB, aspiration, fungal or varicella
Discharge Patient Instructions
Discharge patient as per as per provider specific instructions: ______
Patient Care

Risk stratify using clinical judgement OR Calculate CRB-65 Score. Assign 1 point each for:  - Confusion (MMSE less than 9 or new disorientation to person, place or time)   - RR greater than or equal to 30 breaths/min   - SBP less than 90 mmHg or DBP less than 60 mmHg  - Age 65 years or more
Consider risk factors for resistance and use broader spectrum only when necessary. Reassess after 3 days of therapy for appropriateness, narrowing, step-down, or discontinuation
Medications
Low Risk (CRB-65 Score 0-1) - mild Community Acquired Pneumonia
amoxicillin
1,000 mg, PO, TID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: cap, first dose: NOW
500 mg, PO, TID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: cap, first dose: NOW
For penicillin or amoxicillin allergy (e.g. anaphylaxis), select cefuroxime
cefuroxime
500 mg, PO, TID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
If unable to take beta-lactams, select doxycycline
doxycycline
100 mg, PO, BID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: cap, first dose: NOW
Intermediate Risk (CRB-65 Score 2) - moderate Community Acquired Pneumonia
amoxicillin-clavulanate 875 mg-125 mg tab (dosed as amoxicillin)
875 mg, PO, BID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
For penicillin or amoxicillin allergy (e.g. anaphylaxis), select cefuroxime
cefuroxime
500 mg, PO, TID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
If atypical bacteria expected, ADD [doxycycline OR azithromycin] (Not routinely recommended in non-severe CAP)
doxycycline
200 mg, PO, once, drug form: cap, first dose: NOW
doxycycline
100 mg, PO, BID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: cap
azithromycin
500 mg, PO, qdaily, order duration: 3 day, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
If patient has a known allergy to cefuroxime or a severe allergy to beta-lactams, select MOXIfloxacin. Provider must check QT interval and assess risk of cardiac complications
MOXIfloxacin
400 mg, PO, qdaily, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
